results.title: Colour of war [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alastair Laurence, Lucy Carter, Transworld International and Carlton Television
results.brief_description:
Almost all our recollections of the Second World War are in black and white. But years of research have unearthed hours of previously unseen colour film offering a completely new portrait of the war. The result is ‘Colour Of War’ a remarkable insight into the event that has shaped our modern world. Dramatic colour footage from as early as 1933 shows home movies of Adolf Hitler and his co-horts, the devastation wrought by the Blitz, life on the home front, D-Day and the Allied Invasion of France, British bombers defying German fighters, the horror of the Holocaust that greeted troops as they entered Germany and the jubilation of VE Day. With John Thaw’s narration and spoken accounts from the letters and diaries of those who fought, those who survived, and those the war claimed as victims, this three part documentary is an extraordinary remembrance.
1. ‘A new world order’ Reccollections of those involved during the pre-war turmoil of 1930s when the rhetoric of ideology and extremism was increasingly being heard. Highlights include combat footage of the Spanish Civil War, the coronation of King George VI in 1937, spectacular mass rallies in Germany and the Soviet Union and the images of the devastation of the Blitz in Great Britain.
2. ‘Total War’ Focuses on the period when the war reached a new, global intensity, beginning with the bombing of Pearl Harbor in December 1941 and ending in the Summer of 1944 with US Marines fighting bloody battles with the Japanese in the Pacific.
3. ‘Triumph and despair’ The experiences of British, American and Canadian soldiers, who made the historic crossing of the Channel, and who fought through The Battle of the Hedgerows to liberate Northern France, are heard through their letters and diaries. The fears and emotions expressed by American, French and Japanese soldiers and Japanese and German civilians are accompanied by footage of the fall of Berlin, the Battle of Okinawa, Kamikaze attacks and the devastation of the Atom bomb. This volume concludes with footage of the release of POWs, refugees and displaced people and reflects on the legacy of a war which cost 50 million lives.

Also available on VHS [313552], [313553], and [313554].

results.title: The Otto cycle: gasoline engine
results.creator_credit: Visual Aids Committee, American Association of Physic Teachers and Audio Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Graphically presents the six processes in the gasoline engine cycle. The ideal situation with the elimination of disturbing factors is demonstrated and the Otto cycle is traced on a pressure-volume diagram. The concept of thermal efficiency is discussed in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Visual Aids Committee, American Association of Physic Teachers and Audio Productions

group_siblings.title: Measurement of the speed of light
The Carnot cycle and the Kelvin temperature scale

results.title: The Carnot cycle and the Kelvin temperature scale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
The motion of a piston in a cylinder and a moving point on a pressure-volume diagram are used in explaining the four ideal processes which constitute the Carnot cycle. Shows heat being absorbed and rejected during the cycle and defines the Kelvin scale.

results.title: Measurement of the speed of light
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
The toothed-wheel method of Fizeau is described with the aid of a moving light beam. Modification of this method, due to Michelson, is explained by reflecting the light beam from a rotating eight-sided mirror. Motion is slow enough so that the path of light may be understood at all times.

results.title: Uniform circular motion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”
Uniform circular motion is defined and demonstrated. Changes in velocity vector are shown and used to explain why this is accelerated motion. Expression for magnitude of centripetal force is explained in general and illustrated in connection with a body whirling on a string, a car on a loop-the-loop gravitational attraction and motion of electricity charged particle in a magnetic field.

results.title: Stationary transverse waves
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Animated drawings are used in explaining the nature of stationary waves. Includes demonstrations of pulse reflection at the fixed end of a stretched string, the reflection of a steady wave train at the string boundary, and compounding of oppositely travelling wave trains. Identifies nodes and anti-nodes, and shows the resonance patterns for a stretched string of limited length.

results.title: The U238 radioactive series
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”
The various stages in the decay of U-238 to stable lead. Alpha emission, beta emission and the statistical nature of the process is emphasised. A brief mention is made of other radioactive series.

results.title: Simple harmonic motion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Explains simple harmonic motion - the forces to produce it, and the forces it may produce. The mathematic of simple harmonic motion and the relevent motion are examined. For physics students only.
